issue.title: Fix for http2-prior-knowledge when reusing connections.

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
- refs #10634 where errors in the HTTP/2 framing layer are observed.
- the bug was that on connection reuse, the code attempted to switch in yet another layer of HTTP/2 handling instead of detecting that this was already in place.
- added pytest testcase reproducing the issue.

body:
Thanks for the report. I made a test case and fix in #10643.

As to my analysis, the error should have always happened on the 2nd URL that used the same connection.

Yes it's possible that is what happened.  My actual case is some custom code which is quite a lot more complicated, and so I tried to reduce it down to something that happens with only the `curl` command.

I have tested your proposed patch and it works fine for me, both with `curl` and with my actual code.

issue.title: "SSL connect error", "Error in the HTTP2 framing layer" while using edge functions

repository.name: pg_net
repository.description: A PostgreSQL extension that enables asynchronous (non-blocking) HTTP/HTTPS requests with SQL

issue.body:
## Problem

A customer has reported "SSL connect error", "Error in the HTTP2 framing layer" showing in the `pg_net._http_response` table while making calls to Supabase edge functions. The customer informs this happens after 270 requests. 

This seems to be related to `libcurl`:

- https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/3750
- https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/10634. According to https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/cbe9d82c22c38753ad6372e5040e4c51b3695dc7, this fix is available on curl 8.0.0. While the Supabase platform has `curl 7.68.0`.

## Proposal

Vendor `libcurl`, this way we get the latest fixes and we're not dependent on the Supabase platform version.

issue.title: HTTP2 issues with curl download in oscap_acquire

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
#### Description of Problem:

Fails to download files via curl if http2 is used. Consider providing way to disable HTTP2 - it was not working with latest version of curl, atleast on alpine linux


OpenSCAP Error: Download failed: Stream error in the HTTP/2 framing layer [/home/buildozer/aports/community/openscap/src/openscap-1.3.10/src/common/oscap_acquire.c:405]

#### OpenSCAP Version:


#### Operating System & Version:

Alpine 3.20 docker image
openscap 1.3.10

#### Steps to Reproduce:

1. run xccdf  eval on debian 12 - e.g.
oscap-docker image  debian:12 xccdf eval --fetch-remote-resources --profile xccdf_org.ssgproject.content_profile_cis_level2_server --results /report/ssg-results.xml --report /report/ssg-results.html /ssg/scap-security-guide-0.1.75/ssg-debian12-ds.xml;
2. tries to fetch oval files and fails on HTTP2 frame - likely bug in curl



#### Actual Results:


#### Expected Results:

There is no way to force HTTP1.1 - i tried using .curlrc file but it did not help


#### Additional Information / Debugging Steps:

To quote from https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9113.html#name-connection-specific-header- headers like 'TE' are not allowed in HTTP/2 and lead to a stream reset. Apache is correct in its behaviour.

The question is now: is the libcurl application wrong in adding the header or should curl, when selecting HTTP/2, automatically strip the header from the request.

issue.title: Error in the HTTP2 framing layer observed sporadically on AMF causing UE registrations to fail

labels.name: Housekeeping:ToClose
labels.description: Issues reviewed and closed. Old requests, issues which are not bug, feature or documentation request

repository.name: open5gs
repository.description: Open5GS is a C-language Open Source implementation for 5G Core and EPC, i.e. the core network of LTE/NR network (Release-17)

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Open5GS Release, Revision, or Tag

v2.7.6

### Steps to reproduce

Try to register multiple UE's (> 1000) with a single instance of Open5gs AMF over multiple iterations.


### Logs

```shell
10/15 07:24:32.284: [amf] DEBUG: amf_state_operational(): AMF_EVENT_5GMM_MESSAGE (../src/amf/amf-sm.c:84)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [amf] INFO: [suci-0-001-01-0000-0-0-2000003974] known UE by SUCI (../src/amf/context.c:1907)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG: gmm_state_de_registered(): AMF_EVENT_5GMM_MESSAGE (../src/amf/gmm-sm.c:94)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] INFO: Registration request (../src/amf/gmm-sm.c:1631)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] INFO: [suci-0-001-01-0000-0-0-2000003974]    SUCI (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:186)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     OLD TSC[UE:0,AMF:0] KSI[UE:5,AMF:5] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:252)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     NEW TSC[UE:0,AMF:0] KSI[UE:5,AMF:5] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:259)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     OLD TAI[PLMN_ID:00f110,TAC:1] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:304)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     OLD NR_CGI[PLMN_ID:00f110,CELL_ID:0x1001] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:306)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     TAI[PLMN_ID:00f110,TAC:1] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:309)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     NR_CGI[PLMN_ID:00f110,CELL_ID:0x1001] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:312)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG:     SERVED_TAI_INDEX[0] (../src/amf/gmm-handler.c:329)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] DEBUG: OGS_SBI_GET_NF_INSTANCE [nf_instance:0x55a6c2d7b8c8,service_name:nausf-auth] (../lib/sbi/path.c:298)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] DEBUG: [POST] http://10.30.30.207:7001/nausf-auth/v1/ue-authentications (../lib/sbi/client.c:787)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] DEBUG: SENDING...[106] (../lib/sbi/client.c:544)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] DEBUG: {"supiOrSuci":"suci-0-001-01-0000-0-0-2000003974","servingNetworkName":"5G:mnc001.mcc001.3gppnetwork.org"} (../lib/sbi/client.c:546)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG: gmm_state_de_registered(): EXIT (../src/amf/gmm-sm.c:94)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [gmm] DEBUG: gmm_state_authentication(): ENTRY (../src/amf/gmm-sm.c:2044)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] WARNING: Error in the HTTP2 framing layer (16):  (../lib/sbi/client.c:757)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] WARNING: ogs_sbi_client_handler() failed [-1] (../lib/sbi/path.c:62)
10/15 07:24:32.284: [sbi] DEBUG: [201:POST] http://10.30.30.207:7001/nausf-auth/v1/ue-authentications (../lib/sbi/client.c:734)
```

### Expected behaviour

We should not get Error in the HTTP2 framing layer and nausf-auth api should dispatch properly

### Observed Behaviour

We are getting Error in the HTTP2 framing layer causing the http2 request not to be dispatched from AMF to AUSF

### eNodeB/gNodeB

_No response_

### UE Models and versions

_No response_
